intro: Galeopsis tetrahit subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy heartwort, is a member of the Lamiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, two-lipped flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are blue to purple in color and attract various pollinators.
